DeregistrationReasonOtherText: Ivalee Facility will no longer be a Propane Transport Terminal Facility

_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Bulk plant tanks, valves, piping, fittings, and hoses
_prev_prog_2.Description:
Safety training, hazard review, operating procedures training, maintenance, and inspections are parts of our overall company safety policy, which follows:

PURPOSE:  To fulfill our moral obligation and to establish sound business practices designed to prevent accidents and injuries.

SCOPE:  All employees, customers, and the general public.

POLICY:  SAFETY IS THE TOP PRIORITY OF THIS COMPANY.  Nothing is more important than the lives and well-being of our employees, customers, and the general public.  We believe that it is possible, barring acts of nature, to eliminate all accidents and injuries and will work diligently toward that goal.  This company is committed to providing a safe and healthy work environment; raising the level of safety awareness among employees and propane users; providing safety and job skills training; insisting on safe operating practices; handling propane in a safe manner; providing safe consumer propane installations; and providing and promoting consumer propane safety education.

RESPONSIBILITY:  Each employee is responsible for safety and must adhere to this policy in performing his/her duties.  All company management will implement and enforce this policy.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental release prevention and emergency policies:  This facility complies with NFPA-58 requirements for LP-gas storage, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.

2. Description of facility and regulated substances handled:  The primary purpose of this facility is to repackage and distribute propane to wholesale customers.  Propane is used by our wholesale customers as a fuel.  Propane is received by railcar and truck (transports) and stored in six (6) 30,000-gallon storage tanks.  Propane is distributed to wholesale customers by truck (transports and bobtails).  This facility has equipment for loading and unloading transports, unloading railcars, and loading bobtails.  Access to the site is restricted to authorized facility employees, authorized management personnel, and authorized contractors.  The regulated substance handled at this distribution facility is propane.

3. Worst-case and alternative release scenarios:  Our worst-case scenario is failure of one (1) 30,000-gallon storage tank when filled to the greatest amount allowed (88% at 60F), resulting in a vapor cloud explosion.  The resulting distance to the endpoint extends offsite, and public receptors are within the distance to the endpoint.  Our alternative release scenario is a pull-away causing failure of a 20-foot length of 2-inch hose.  The excess flow valves function to stop the flow.  The contents of the hose would be released, resulting in an explosion.  The resulting distance to the endpoint extends offsite, and public receptors are within the distance to the endpoint.

4. General accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:  This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The propane system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA-58 and state law.

5. Five-year accident history:  We have never had an accident involving propane t

hat caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or shelterings in place.

6. Emergency response program:  In the event of an emergency involving our propane system, it is our policy to notify the Attalla Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

7. Planned changes to improve safety:  Replacement of relief valves, excess flow valves, block valves, line valves, pressure gauges, thermometers, hydrostatic relief valves; installation of fencing at compressor station and railcar unloading entrances.

8. This facility is only staffed by employees when product transfer is taking place.
